subject: Career
title: The Anchoring Effect in Offers
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Anchoring Effect in Offers.

hook.text: They offer $85K. Now every counter you make revolves around $85K. You've been anchored.

buildup.text: The first number in any negotiation disproportionately shapes the final outcome.

discovery.text: If you can name your number first with a justification, you set the anchor instead.

twist.text: But anchoring too high without data feels delusional. The anchor must be backed by evidence.

climax.text: 'Based on market data, I'm targeting $105K-$115K.' â€” specific, defensible, and high.

punchline.text: Set the anchor or live inside theirs.

quiz.question: What is the anchoring effect in negotiation?
options: The first number shapes the entire range
The final offer is always the anchor
